36 million people have filed for unemployment in the last two months.

But for too many, our economy wasn’t working long before COVID-19. As we recover, we must build an economy that works for everyone—not just those at the top.

In awe of Sylvia Goldsholl's beautiful spirit and resilience. At the age of 108, she has survived the coronavirus and is on the road to recovery.  
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/15/nyregion/sylvia-goldsholl-recovered-coronavirus.html

They’re trying to dismantle the United States Postal Service and privatize it. We must fight with every breath we have to make sure USPS workers are protected and everyone has access to reliable, affordable mail service. Congress must take immediate action to protect the USPS.
If there's anything I hope we learn out of this painful experience, it is that maybe we create an economy and a government that works for all, not just the few and wealthy campaign contributors.

This administration must be held accountable.

66 years ago Brown v. Board was decided and it changed the trajectory of my life. Without this decision, I likely wouldn’t have become a lawyer or eventually be elected a Senator from California. 

Remember, the direction of the Supreme Court is on the ballot in November. Vote.

I’m #WickedProud that 16 years ago today, Massachusetts was the first state to make marriage equality the law of the land. I’ll never stop fighting for LGBTQ+ rights & equality so everyone can be who they are and love who they love without fear or discrimination.
